definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131

sentences.english: I have met the enemy and brought him to his knees.
sentences.chinese: 我已遭遇到敵手，並使他俯首稱臣。

sentences.english: There are many small countries bow their head to Da T'ang at that time.
sentences.chinese: 當時大唐周邊許多小國甘願俯首稱臣。

sentences.english: Natural color has given way to such Bright-colored artificial dyestuff in effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 面對如此色彩斑斕的人工染料，自然色彩已俯首稱臣。

sentences.english: The pride of the black cats as girls, waiting for you to kneel.
sentences.chinese: 黑貓的驕傲如同女生，等待你來俯首稱臣。

sentences.english: 'One China' is only kowtowing to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: “一箇中國”只是向北京俯首稱臣罷了。

sentences.english: The delta warlords had been laid low.
sentences.chinese: 尼羅河三角洲地區的軍閥都對他俯首稱臣。

definition: lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to whisper to one another's ear
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
